Interface Component

All Known Implementing Classes:
AccordionModule, AccountWidget, Alert, Audio, Badge, Blockquote, Breadcrumb, Button, CalloutModule, Card, CardGrid, Checkbox, Code, Column, Comment, CommentThread, ComparisonModule, Container, ContentModule, DataModule, DataTable, Div, Divider, DynamicCardModule, DynamicListModule, DynamicTableModule, EditableModule, EditablePage, EditableRow, Form, FormModule, ForumModule, ForumPost, Gallery, GalleryModule, Grid, Header, HeroModule, HtmlTag, Icon, Image, InfoBox, Label, Link, ListItem, Markdown, Modal, Module, NavBar, NavBar.NavItem, OrderedList, Page, Paragraph, PostList, ProgressBar, QuoteModule, RadioGroup, RawHtml, RichContentModule, Row, Section, Select, Select.Option, SideNav, SideNav.NavItem, SideNav.Section, SimpleListModule, Slot, Spacer, Spinner, StatsModule, Table, Table.Cell, Table.Row, TabsModule, Tag, TemplateComponent, TextArea, TextInput, TextNode, TimelineModule, UnorderedList, Video
public interface Component
Base interface for all renderable UI components in the Java HTML Framework.

The Component interface defines the contract for any element that can be rendered to HTML. All components must implement the render() method which generates the HTML string representation of the component.

Component Hierarchy

Component (interface)
└── HtmlTag (abstract class) - Base implementation
    ├── Basic Components (Div, Paragraph, Header, etc.)
    ├── Form Components (TextInput, Select, Button, etc.)
    ├── Display Components (Table, Card, Alert, etc.)
    ├── Media Components (Gallery, Video, Audio)
    ├── Forum Components (ForumPost, Comment, etc.)
    ├── Navigation Components (Link, NavBar, SideNav)
    ├── Layout Components (Row, Column, Grid)
    └── Module (abstract class) - High-level compositions
        ├── ContentModule
        ├── FormModule
        ├── DataModule
        └── GalleryModule

Usage Example

// Simple component usage
Component header = Header.H1("Welcome");
String html = header.render();  // Returns: <h1>Welcome</h1>

// Nested components
Component div = new Div()
    .withChild(Header.H2("Title"))
    .withChild(new Paragraph().withInnerText("Content"));
String html = div.render();  // Returns nested HTML structure

// In a Spring controller
@GetMapping("/page")
@ResponseBody
public String myPage() {
    Component page = Page.builder()
        .addComponents(Header.H1("My Page"))
        .build();
    return page.render();
}

Design Philosophy

  • Server-Side Rendering: All HTML generation happens on the server
  • Type Safety: Compile-time checks for component structure
  • Composability: Components can contain other components
  • Fluent API: Method chaining for readable component construction
See Also:
  • HtmlTag

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default String
    render()
    Renders this component to an HTML string with an empty context.
    default String
    render(RenderContext context)
    Renders this component to an HTML string using the provided context.

  • Method Details

    • render

      default String render(RenderContext context)
      Renders this component to an HTML string using the provided context.

      This method is responsible for generating the complete HTML representation of the component, including all nested children and attributes, resolving any dynamic slots from the context.

      Parameters:
      context - the context containing values for dynamic slots
      Returns:
      HTML string representation of this component

    • render

      default String render()
      Renders this component to an HTML string with an empty context.

      This is a convenience method that delegates to render(RenderContext) with RenderContext.empty().

      Returns:
      HTML string representation of this component
